Enter the nameservers (one per line) that users should be instructed to point their domains to if using their own domain.

setting.conf_title: Email Addresses to Notify on Error
setting.conf_description: Enter the Email addresses, separated by commas, that you want to be notified in the event of an error interacting with the hosting server.

setting.conf_title: Number of days before terminating accounts
setting.conf_description:
If a customer does not renew their hosting package, it will be suspended. After how many days would you like to terminate the account?
Enter 0 to terminate immediately or -1 to never terminate.

If you wish to allow customers to purchase additional bandwidth, enter the options in the format:
amount=price
The amount should be in MB and the price should be the price without the currency symbol. For example:
5000=10

Enter one option per line

setting.conf_title: Include HTTP authentication in Control Panel links?

setting.conf_description: Enter the URL to the monitoring script. You can obtain the monitoring script from the Tools directory in the IP.Nexus package.
You can specify an additional copy of the monitoring script which will be checked if a server reports a fail to prevent false negatives.
You can specify the number of times that a server can fail before alerts are sent. This allows the server time to ensure it is not a temporary issue.
Enter the email addresses that you want to be contacted, separated by a comma, when a server has failed to respond more that the specified fail times.
If a server fails to respond this number of time and not been acknowledged, an additional email will be sent to the emails above.

Specify the email address that notifications about monitoring should be sent from.
If you have configured this incoming email for this address, replies to monitoring messages will be sent to all the specified notification emails.
This MUST be a different address to your main outgoing address.
If enabled, customers will be able to see an overview any servers reported as offline by the monitoring scripts.
Enter any additional info you would like to show on the network status page.

When a customer makes a purchase over the amount specified, they will be able to split the payment across multiple payment methods.
Enter 0 for no restriction, or -1 to not allow split payments at all.

When marking a transaction as "Under Review" - Nexus will prompt you to create a support request for the customer so you can explain the delay. This setting allows you to use one of your Stock Actions as the default when creating these support requests.

setting.conf_title: Number of days before item expires that invoice is generated

setting.conf_description:
If a customer has a credit card on file, payment is taken automatically when the invoice is generated. This setting can be used to send customers an Email before payment is taken to let them know that will happen.
This only applies to customers with credit cards on file.

setting.conf_title: Number of days before invoice expires
setting.conf_description: This should be the number of days after an invoice has been generated that the user has to pay before it is marked as expired.

setting.conf_title: Allow users to view commission rules?
setting.conf_description: Users will only be able to see the commission rules that apply to them.
If the above setting is no, you can enter alternate text that you'd like users to be able to see instead which should explain the commission they'll receive for referrals.
If yes and a user has credit on their account, they will be able to request their credit to be paid out. This setting is recommended in conjunction with IP.Downloads integration.
If the above setting is yes, you can specify a minimum payout amount.
The groups specified will not receive any commission from referrals or IP.Downloads integration. This overrides all other commission-related settings.

setting.conf_title_desc: Control settings for the store, the client area and handling orders

setting.conf_description:
If you are using multiple languages with different locales, you should set this to the locale to use for formatting currencies.
Most users can leave this setting blank.

You can configure packages to automatically move users into a new group when they purchase a package.
Select here the groups which should not be moved out of their group. You will usually want to select any administrator or moderator groups so that they do not lose their power.
This only applies to primary group changes. Secondary groups or additional permission masks will still be added.
Note that regardless of this setting, an administrator will never be moved into a group without Admin CP privileges.

This setting forces the checkout process, support requests and the personal information section of the client area to be served over https.
You MUST first ensure SSL works for your domain (contact your host if unsure).

This setting is required for some payment gateways
Select the groups that can access the store. Leave blank to allow all groups.

The value entered here will be shown next to prices and can be used to explain if the price includes tax or not. For example, you might enter "incl. vat".

setting.conf_title: Attempt to ignore auto responder replies?
setting.conf_description: When processing incoming mail, by default, successive emails within 60 seconds by the same sender are ignored to prevent auto responder loops. Disabling this setting will cause all incoming mail to be processed including those from auto responders.
You only need to configure this (and other settings below) if you are using POP3 as you're incoming Email method. More information
